H0.text: Mass number is the property in which protons and electrons are always equal.

H1.text: Kinetic energy is the respect in which protons and electrons are always equal.

H2.text: The sign of charge is the respect in which protons and electrons are always equal.

H3.text: The magnitude of charge is the respect in which protons and electrons are always equal.

A5.text: Electrons have an electric charge of −1.602176634×10−19 C, which is used as a standard unit of charge for subatomic particles, and is also called the elementary charge. Within the limits of experimental accuracy, the electron charge is identical to the charge of a proton, but with the opposite sign.

A6.text: Within the limits of experimental accuracy, the electron charge is identical to the charge of a proton, but with the opposite sign.
